questionListItems.title: Will I be able to access the bank statements of my deceased next-of-kin?

answer.body:
As the banks are required to comply with customer information confidentiality requirements under the Banking Act, the banks are unable to disclose details pertaining to the bank account(s) held by the deceased without the appropriate court documents such as the Grant of Probate (if the deceased made a will) or Grant of Letters of Administration (if the deceased did not make a will).


You can check the Family Justice Courts website - https://www.judiciary.gov.sg/family/apply-for-letters-of-administration) or enquire with the Family Justice Courts for more information on the court procedure.

questionListItems.title: Is it possible for me to close my deceased next-of-kin's bank accounts without a letter of probate?

answer.body: We regret that we are unable to assist you with this enquiry as we cannot provide you with legal advice. You may wish to seek professional legal advice if necessary.

questionListItems.title: How do I check whether my deceased next-of-kin made a CPF nomination?

answer.body: Please contact CPF at https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/contact-us on your query.

questionListItems.title: How do I pulverize the cremated remains of my deceased next-of-kin?

answer.body:
The National Environment Agency can only pulverised the cremated remains under the following circumstances:
 
 a) At the time of collecting the cremated remains after cremation at Mandai Crematorium; 
 b) At the time of collecting the cremated exhumed remains after exhumation at Choa Chu Kang cemetery; and
 c) For the usage of Inland Ash Scattering (IAS) Facility at Garden of Peace.

questionListItems.title: What is the process for repatriating a body from Singapore, and is the export status indicated on the death certificate?

answer.body: The death certificate will only reflect details of the deceased and cause of death. To export a body out of Singapore, you will need to apply for an export permit with NEA Port Health. For more details, please visit https://www.nea.gov.sg/our-services/port-health/overview.

questionListItems.title: What do I do if there is missing information in my MyInfo profile that I synced for the Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) and/or Advance Care Planning (ACP) draft?

answer.body: Please contact us at https://mylegacy.life.gov.sg/contact/ on the matter. In the meantime, you can also visit the Office of Public Guardian Online - https://opg-eservice.msf.gov.sg/OPGO/Home.aspx to complete your LPA application.

questionListItems.title: What should I do if I encounter an error while drafting the Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) and/or Advance Care Planning (ACP) in My Legacy site?

answer.body:
Please contact us at https://mylegacy.life.gov.sg/contact/ with the following information:

  1. Device used mobile (iOS/Android)/desktop

  2. Browser: Safari/Chrome/Microsoft Edge with the browser version if possible

  3. Steps taken - what was clicked to reach the issue

  4. Screenshot(s) of the issue

questionListItems.title: If the patient has been in and out of A&E but passed on at home, should the next-of-kin (NOK) contact the doctor from the hospital who treated the deceased or call the nearby GP who has no medical record of the deceased?

answer.body: The Next-of-Kin can call any medical practitioner to certify the death and share the deceased's pre-existing medical conditions and reports.

questionListItems.title: If the next-of-kin (NOK) do not have a smart phone, can they proceed to police station to report death when the doctor certified death at home?

answer.body:
There is no need to go to a police station to report death. Death is registered automatically when the doctor certifies the death online. If death is certified after operating hours, you can either:


  1. Seek assistance from friends/family/volunteers to download/print a copy of the digital death certificate from My Legacy on their behalf; or

  2. Let the certifying doctor know that you require a hard copy. The certifying doctor/hospital would either issue a printed copy of the digital death certificate or a written document known as Confirmation of Death that provides the death certification details After settling the post-death matters, you can download/print the digital death certificate from My Legacy if required.

questionListItems.title: Do we still need to inform the police, bank & CPF if the deceased pass on?

answer.body: There is no need to go to police station to register death now. To settle the deceased's monies, you will need to find out if the deceased had made any will and CPF nomination. Please refer to My Legacy website for guidance on these matters.

questionListItems.title: If their godparents who have no next-of-kin passed on next time, how to apply for death certificate?

answer.body: Only Next-of-Kin of the deceased or persons authorised by the Next-of-Kin are allowed to download a copy of the digital death certificate from My Legacy. You may ask the hospital or doctor to provide you a hardcopy printout of the death certificate if you need to settle their immediate post-death matters.

questionListItems.title: If every deceased will be brought into mortuary to prevent fraud cases from happening?

answer.body: All deaths in Singapore will be certified by a registered doctor. If the doctor is unable to determine the cause of death or if the death is an unnatural one, the doctor should report the death to the police for investigations. You may refer to the following https://mylegacy.life.gov.sg/when-death-happens/report-the-death/ for more information.

questionListItems.title: How to amend the address on the digital death certificate? It was wrongly entered by the doctor.

answer.body:
You can inform the doctor about the error and ask him to amend the information in the death certificate online. 

An updated death certificate will be available for you to download after doctor has amended it. The earlier death certificate will also be invalidated.

questionListItems.title: Can my family members access to my vault if I passed on next time?

answer.body: Family members/loved ones will have access to the information in the Vault if they have been added as Trusted Persons by the Vault user previously. You can refer to https://mylegacy.life.gov.sg/frequently-asked-questions/ under the title ‘My Legacy Vault’ for more information.

questionListItems.title: How to check if the deceased has any funeral plans stated in My Legacy?

answer.body: We are not authorized to check the deceased's vault. Family members will have access to the information in the Vault if they have been added as Trusted Persons by the Vault user. You can refer to https://mylegacy.life.gov.sg/frequently-asked-questions/ under the title ‘My Legacy Vault’ for more information.
